source.description:
Gently mix 10 times by pipetting and spin down the LunaScript RT SuperMix reagents (contains primers). Prepare the cDNA synthesis reaction as described below:
COMPONENTVOLUME
RNA Sample*8 µl
(lilac) LunaScript RT SuperMix2 µl
Total Volume10 µl

COMPONENTVOLUME
RNA Sample*8 µl
(lilac) LunaScript RT SuperMix2 µl
Total Volume10 µl

Incubate reactions in a thermocycler with lid temperature at 105°C with the following steps:
CYCLE STEPTEMPTIMECYCLES
Primer Annealing25°C2 minutes1
cDNA Synthesis55°C20 minutes
Heat Inactivation95°C1 minute
Hold4°C∞

CYCLE STEPTEMPTIMECYCLES
Primer Annealing25°C2 minutes1
cDNA Synthesis55°C20 minutes
Heat Inactivation95°C1 minute
Hold4°C∞

source.body: Samples can be stored at if they are not used immediately.

cDNA from 2 µl to 4.5 µl can be used as input. When using less than 4.5 µl of cDNA, add nuclease-free water to a final cDNA volume of 4.5 µl. We recommend setting up the cDNA synthesis and cDNA amplification reactions in different rooms to minimize cross-contamination of future reactions.
Use of the NEBNext ARTIC Human Primer Mix 1 and 2 are optional. If used, the appropriate ARTIC Human Primer Mix and ARTIC Primer Pool should be combined prior to use. More specifically, ARTIC Human Primer Mix 1 should be combined with ARTIC Primer Pool 1 and ARTIC Human Primer Mix 2 with ARTIC Primer Pool 2. Mixing directions are listed below.

source.description:

(lilac) Q5 Hot Start High-Fidelity 2X MM6.25 µl

Incubate reactions in a thermocycler with the following steps:
CYCLE STEPTEMPTIMECYCLES
Initial Denaturation98°C30 seconds1
Denature95°C15 seconds35
Annealing/Extension63°C5 minutes
Hold4°C∞1

source.body: Samples can be stored at if they are not used immediately.

source.description:
If prefer to omit the cleanup step, please follow the newer version of ncoV-2010 sequencing protocol v3 (LoCost)
https://www.protocols.io/view/ncov-2019-sequencing-protocol-v3-locost-bh42j8ye/abstract

source.body: SPRIselect or AMPure® XP Beads can be used as well. If using AMPure XP Beads, allow the beads to warm to for at least 30 minutes before use. These bead volumes may not work properly for a cleanup at a different step in the workflow. For cleanups of samples contained in different buffer conditions, the volumes may need to be experimentally determined.

source.description: Vortex SPRIselect or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads to resuspend.

Add
to the combined PCR reaction. Mix well by flicking the tube or pipetting up and down to mix and a very short 2-3 seconds quick centrifugation. Be sure to stop the centrifugation before the beads start to settle out.

Incubate samples at
for
.

Place the tubes on an appropriate magnetic stand to separate the beads from the supernatant. If necessary, quickly spin the sample
to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube before placing on the magnetic stand.
After 2 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.

source.body: Caution: do not discard the beads.

Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tube for

source.body: Caution: Do not over-dry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack, they are too dry.

source.description:
Remove the tube from the magnetic stand. Elute the DNA target from the beads by adding
.

Mix well by flicking the tube or pipetting up and down to mix and followed by a very short centrifugation. Incubate for
at
. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing back on the magnetic stand.

Place the tube on the magnetic stand. After 2 minutes (or when the solution is clear), transfer
to PCR tubes.
We recommend assessing cDNA concentrations with a Qubit fluorometer. Amplicons may also be run on a Bioanalyzer® or a TapeStation to confirm 400 bp size of amplicons.

source.body: Samples can be stored at if they are not used immediately.

COMPONENTVOLUME
Targeted cDNA Amplicons (Step 22)12.5 µl
(green) NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Reaction Buffer1.75 µl
(green) NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Enzyme Mix 0.75 µl
Total Volume 15 µl

COMPONENTVOLUME
Targeted cDNA Amplicons (Step 22)12.5 µl
(green) NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Reaction Buffer1.75 µl
(green) NEBNext Ultra II End Prep Enzyme Mix 0.75 µl
Total Volume 15 µl
Flick the tube or pipet up and down to mix the solution. Perform a quick spin to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.

source.body: It is important to mix well. The presence of a small amount of bubbles will not interfere with performance.

source.body: If necessary, samples can be stored at for a few days; however, a slight loss in yield (~20%) may be observed. We recommend continuing with barcode ligation before stopping.

source.description:
Add the following components directly to a sterile nuclease-free PCR tube:
COMPONENTVOLUME
(white) Nuclease-free water 6 µl
End-prepped DNA (Previous Step)1.5 µl
Native Barcode*2.5 µl
(red) Blunt/TA Ligase Master Mix**10 µl
Total Volume20 µl

COMPONENTVOLUME
(white) Nuclease-free water 6 µl
End-prepped DNA (Previous Step)1.5 µl
Native Barcode*2.5 µl
(red) Blunt/TA Ligase Master Mix**10 µl
Total Volume20 µl
Flick the tube or pipet up and down to mix solution. Perform a quick spin to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.

source.body: Caution: The Blunt/TA Ligase Master Mix is very viscous. Care should be taken to ensure adequate mixing of the ligation reaction, as incomplete mixing will result in reduced ligation efficiency. The presence of a small amount of bubbles will not interfere with performance.

Pool all barcoded samples into a 1.5 ml DNA LoBind Tube.
The following section is for cleanup of the ligation reaction.

source.body: The volumes of SPRIselect or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads provided here are for use with the sample contained in the exact buffer at this step. AMPure XP Beads can be used as well. If using AMPure XP Beads, allow the beads to warm to for at least 30 minutes before use.

source.description: Vortex NEBNext Sample Purification Beads to resuspend.

Add 0.4X resuspended beads to pooled barcode samples (Step 30) (for example,
should be added to a pool of 24 barcoded samples where the sample volume is 480 µl). Mix well by flicking the tube. Perform a quick spin for
to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.

Incubate samples on bench top for
at
.

Place the tube on a 1.5 ml magnetic stand (such as NEB S1506) to separate the beads from the supernatant. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing on the magnetic stand.
After 2 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.

source.body: Caution: do not discard the beads.

source.description: Place the tube on an appropriate magnetic stand for 2 minutes (or when the solution is clear) to separate the beads from the supernatant. Remove the supernatant.

Repeat previous 2 steps once for a total of two washes:
Wash the beads by adding
. Flick the tube or pipet up and down to mix to resuspend pellet. If necessary, quickly spin the sample for
to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing back on the magnetic stand.
Place the tube on an appropriate magnetic stand for 2 minutes (or when the solution is clear) to separate the beads from the supernatant. Remove the supernatant.
Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tube, place back on the magnetic stand and remove traces of SFB with a p10 pipette tip
A quick spin and place the sample tube on the magnetic stand, remove any residual ethanol.

Air dry the beads for
while the tube is on the magnetic stand with the lid open.

source.body: Caution: Do not over-dry the beads. This may result in lower recovery of DNA target. Elute the samples when the beads are still dark brown and glossy looking, but when all visible liquid has evaporated. When the beads turn lighter brown and start to crack, they are too dry.

Add the following components into a 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind Tube:
COMPONENTVOLUME
Native barcoded and purified DNA (45)30 µl
Adapter Mix II (AMII)**5 µl
(red) NEBNext Quick Ligation Reaction Buffer (5X)10 µl
(red) NEBNext Quick T4 Ligase5 µl
Total Volume50 µl

Native barcoded and purified DNA (45)30 µl
Adapter Mix II (AMII)**5 µl
(red) NEBNext Quick Ligation Reaction Buffer (5X)10 µl
(red) NEBNext Quick T4 Ligase5 µl
Total Volume50 µl

Flick the tube or pipet up and down to mix solution. Perform a quick spin for
to collect all liquid from the sides of the tube.

source.body: Caution: The NEBNext Quick Ligation Buffer is viscous. Care should be taken to ensure adequate mixing of the ligation reaction, as incomplete mixing will result in reduced ligation efficiency. The presence of a small amount of bubbles will not interfere with performance.

source.body: The volumes of SPRIselect or NEBNext Sample Purification Beads provided here are for use with the sample contained in the exact buffer at this step. AMPure XP beads can be used as well. If using AMPure XP beads, allow the beads to warm to for at least 30 minutes before use. These volumes may not work properly for a cleanup at a different step in the workflow.

After 2 minutes (or when the solution is clear), carefully remove and discard the supernatant. Be careful not to disturb the beads that contain DNA targets.

source.description:
Wash the beads by adding
. Flick the tube or pipet up and down to mix to resuspend pellet. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing back on the magnetic stand. Place the tube on an appropriate magnetic stand.

Repeat previous 2 steps once for a total of two washes:
Wash the beads by adding
. Flick the tube or pipet up and down to mix to resuspend pellet. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing back on the magnetic stand. Place the tube on an appropriate magnetic stand.
Wait for 2 minutes (or when the solution is clear) to separate the beads from the supernatant. Remove the supernatant.
Be sure to remove all visible liquid after the second wash. If necessary, briefly spin the tube/plate, place back on the magnet and remove traces of SFB with a p10 pipette tip.

Remove the tube from the magnetic stand. Elute the DNA target from the beads by adding
provided in SQK-LSK109 kit from Oxford Nanopore.

Resuspend the pellet well in EB buffer by flicking the tube or pipetting up and down to mix. Incubate for
at
. If necessary, quickly spin the sample to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing back on the magnetic stand.

Place the tube/plate on the magnetic stand. After 2 minutes (or when the solution is clear), transfer
to a new DNA LoBind tube.

Use Qubit to quantify
. Follow Oxford Nanopore Protocol SQK-LSK109 to prepare MinION® flow cell and sequencing mix using up to 15 ng adapter-ligated cDNA sample (previous step).
Flick the tube or pipet up and down to mix followed by a quick spin.

For no template controls, mix the following components:
COMPONENTVOLUME
(white) Nuclease-free Water8 µl
(lilac) LunaScript RT SuperMix2 µl
Total Volume10 µl

COMPONENTVOLUME
(white) Nuclease-free Water8 µl
(lilac) LunaScript RT SuperMix2 µl
Total Volume10 µl
Flick the tube or pipet up and down to mix followed by a quick spin.
Combine pool A and pool B PCR Reactions for each sample.

Wash the beads by adding
. Flick the tube or pipet up and down to mix to resuspend pellet. If necessary, quickly spin the sample for
to collect the liquid from the sides of the tube or plate wells before placing back on the magnetic stand.

Place the tube on the magnetic stand. After 2 minutes (or when the solution is clear), transfer
to a new 1.5 ml Eppendorf DNA LoBind Tube.
We recommend assessing cDNA concentrations with a Qubit fluorometer.

description: This protocol details methods for the NEBNext® ARTIC SARS-CoV-2 Companion Kit (Oxford Nanopore Technologies®), NEB #E7660S/L 24/96 reactions.
